sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife

Class ToneUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.matus.ksp.guitarist_swiss_knife.ToneUtils

  • public class ToneUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class should handle all the request regarding tones and their properties

      • generateAllTones

        private void generateAllTones()
        A procedure to expand the basic tones into full range of 8 octaves. Fills the balanced binary tree whose keys are frequencies and values are scientifical names of the tones. In addition, it calculates the maximum precision margins (ranges in which the frequency is associated with the tone itself) both for undertuned and overtuned frequency.

      • generateAlternativeNames

        private void generateAlternativeNames()
        This method calculates alternative names for all of the semitones. It does so by either lifting the lowerSemitone semitones with # flag[s] or by lowering the higherSemitone semitones with b flag[s]

      • bindTones

        private void bindTones()
        * Binds the tones in the semiTone array together: each semitone will know, which semitone is higherSemitone and lowerSemitone than itself

      • isInInterval

        private boolean isInInterval(float f,

      • getTones

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tone> getTones()
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of SemiTones in octave

      • constructScale

        private void constructScale(ToneName root)
        This method constructs the harmonic scale starting from the baseName note. The semitones in the scale obey the standard naming conventions (e.g. No letter is used more than once) It stores the scale both as a list of Tone classes and as a string representation.
        Parameters:
        root - The baseName tone from which to build up the scale

      • getScaleText

        public java.lang.String getScaleText(ToneName root)
        Given the baseName note (String) it constructs the scale and returns its string representation.
        Parameters:
        root - The baseName note of the scale

      • getScaleTones

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tone> getScaleTones(ToneName root)
        Given the baseName note (String) it constructs the scale and returns it as an Array of SemiTones.
        Parameters:
        root - The baseName note of the scale

      • getSemiTonePosition

        public int getSemiTonePosition(ToneName toneName)
        Method resolves the String representation of a tone into its position in the octave.
        Parameters:
        toneName - The toneName to be analysed
        Returns:
        The position of the supplied tone in the semitTone array
